Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back again to watch it.
I was hoping for a modern version of the fable,, or at least something more dynamic with regards to aesthetics… When you look foreword enough, you will enjoy the story with its flaws and appreciate Snow White as a whole being.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the success of The Ninja has just been released on DVD, and it’s one of those films that’s so bad that it can’t help but be hilarious at times.
